\Aura\Filter

\Aura\FilterRule

Classes

All A "meta-rule" indicating that the value must pass all of a series of rules.
Alnum Rule for alphanumeric characters.
Alpha Rule for alphabetic characters.
Any A "meta-rule" indicating that the value must pass at least one of a series of rules.
Between Validates that a value is within a given range.
Blank Validates that a value is blank (null, empty string, or string of only whitespace characters).
Bool Rule for booleans.
Closure Rule to apply a closure to the data.
CreditCard Validates the value as a credit card number.
DateTime Validate and Sanitize date time
Email Validates that a value is an email address.
EqualToField Validates that this value is equal to some other element in the filter chain (note that equality is not strict, so type does not matter).
EqualToValue Validates that this value is equal to some other element in the filter chain (note that equality is not strict, so type does not matter).
Float Rule for floats.
InKeys Validates that the value is a key in the list of allowed options.
Int Sanitizes a value to an integer.
InValues Validates that a value is in a list of allowed values.
Ipv4 Sanitizes a value to an IPv4 address.
Isbn Rule for International Standard Book Numbers (ISBN).
Locale Rule for locale (language and country) codes.
Max Validates that a value is less than than or equal to a maximum.
Method Rule to call a method on the value object; the method should return a boolean to indicate if the filter passed or failed.
Min Validates that a value is greater than or equal to a minimum.
Regex Validates a value using preg_match(), and sanitizes a value to a string using preg_replace().
StrictEqualToField Validates that this value is equal to some other element in the filter chain (note that equality is not strict, so type does not matter).
StrictEqualToValue Validates that this value is equal to some other element in the filter chain (note that equality is not strict, so type does not matter).
String Forces a value to a string, no encoding or escaping.
Strlen Validates that a value's length is within a given range.
StrlenBetween Validates that a value's length is within a given range.
StrlenMax Validates that a value is no longer than a certain length.
StrlenMin Validates that a value is no longer than a certain length.
Trim Sanitizes a value to a string using trim().
Upload Sanitizes a file-upload information array.
Url Validates that a value is a URL.
Word Sanitizes a value to a string with only word characters.
Namespace hierarchy
